type: Renewal of Main and Emergency Switchboard
short_summary: Renewal of Marine craft systems and sub-assemblies for the Watercraft Tanu
description: The Department of Fisheries and Oceans - Canadian Coast Guard has a requirement to supply and deliver a main and emergency marine switchboard for the Canadian Coast Guard Vessel Tanu
full_summary:
================оприалогласный требуют особые шаги:
## Government Tender Announcement

### Call for Proposals for CCGS Tanu Main and Emergency Switchboard Renewal

#### Procurement No.: WS3741874411
#### Title: Marine Craft Systems and Subassemblies (25111900)
#### Tender Closing Date: January 26, 2023, 14:00:00

The Department of Public Works and Government Services on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans, Canadian Coast Guard, invites bidders to submit proposals for the renewal of the main and emergency switchboard on the Canadian Coast Guard Vessel Tanu.

The contract will be awarded based on the selection criteria of Lowest Cost-per-Point, and the agreement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

### Key Information

* **Tender Closing Date**: January 26, 2023, 14:00:00
* **Regions of Delivery**: British Columbia, Canada
* **Inquiry Contact**: Patrick Wass, TPSGC/PWGSC, [patrick.wass@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:patrick.wass@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* **Contract End Date**: March 31, 2026
* **Notice URL**: http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14917701?extsite=MTQ5MTc3MDFfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

### Proposal Requirements

The proposal must include all necessary information to support the tender, including but not limited to:

* Technical specifications of the equipment
* Reasonable warranty and maintenance program for the equipment
* List of relevant references and proven experience in providing the required equipment
* Demonstrated understanding of the technical specifications and requirements

Additionally, bidders are required to respond to the selection criteria of Lowest Cost-per-Point in their proposal.

### Evaluation Criteria

The proposals will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Technical capability to meet the requirements specified in the tender (50%)
* Compliance with instructions (10%)
* Cost (30%)
* Agency/Contractor assessment (10%)

### Language of Submission

The proposal must be submitted in French. ### Registration and Query Process

Bidders are required to register and obtain a copy of the solicitation document on the electronic bid submission website: [www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](http://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca) or on the Ariba
